author: Staff Reporter
text:
Early departure, observing traffic rules and concentration while driving will certainly avoid accidents, according to Collector N. Venkatachalam.

Inaugurating the 27{+t}{+h}road safety week celebrations at Theni central bus stand on Monday, he said that drivers should realise their responsibilities while driving as the lives of hundreds of passengers were in their hands. Moderate speed was need of the hour to prevent accidents, he advised. Regional Transport Officer T. Selva Kumar appealed to drivers to follow traffic rules strictly.

“They should not give room for personal worries or grievances while driving. Drivers should not use mobile phones while driving and avoid drunk driving. They should take sufficient rest before driving vehicles.”

Later, the Collector and the RTO distributed pamphlets to passengers sitting in buses at the central bus stand.

RTO officials also organised an expo.

“Do not give

room for personal worries or grievances

while driving”
title: “Drivers should realise their responsibilities”
